name.text: q007 In the context of data storage, explain the difference between a spreadshee

questiontext.text: In the context of data storage, explain the difference between a spreadsheet and a database.

graderinfo.text: The purpose of both a spreadsheet and a database is to keep track of things. However, unlike a spreadsheet, a database offers the solution of being able to keep track of more than one type of data. Lists of data involving a single theme can be stored in a spreadsheet. However, lists that involve multiple themes require a database.

name.text: q027 Describe the elements in a database.

questiontext.text: Describe the elements in a database.

graderinfo.text: A database is a self-describing collection of integrated records that is organized based on a hierarchy of data elements. A byte is a character of data. Bytes are grouped into columns. Columns are also called fields. A key is a column or group of columns that identifies a unique row in a table. Columns that are keys of a different table than the one in which they reside are called foreign keys. Columns or fields, in turn, are grouped into rows, which are also called records. Finally, a group of similar rows or records is called a table or a file. A database contains, within itself, a description of its contents called metadata. Metadata are data that describe data. Thus, a database is a collection of tables plus relationships among the rows in those tables, plus special data, called metadata, that describes the structure of the database.

name.text: q028 What are relational databases? Discuss their drawbacks that led to the deve

questiontext.text: What are relational databases? Discuss their drawbacks that led to the development of nonrelational style of database processing.

graderinfo.text: Databases that carry their data in the form of tables and that represent relationships using foreign keys are called relational databases. Foreign keys are columns that are keys of a different table than the one in which they reside. The relational model was the single, standard way of processing databases for over thirty years. Recently, however, new styles of database processing have started appearing. Part of the reason is that the major principles of the relational model–fixed-sized tables, representing relationships with foreign keys, and the theory of normalization came about because of limited storage space and limited processing speeds back in the 1960s and early 1970s. At some point, maybe the mid-1990s, these limitations were removed by improved storage and processing technology and today they do not exist. In other words, the relational model is not needed today. Other reasons for the development of nonrelational databases include the need to gain faster performance using many servers and to store new types of data such as images, audio, and videos.

name.text: q029 Describe the merits of metadata.

questiontext.text: Describe the merits of metadata.

graderinfo.text: A database is self-describing in that it contains, within itself, a description of its contents. This is because it contains not only data, but also data about the data in the database. This data is known as metadata. It is the presence of metadata that makes databases much more useful than spreadsheets or data in other lists. Because of metadata, no one needs to guess, remember, or even record what is in a database. To find out what a database contains, we just look at the metadata inside the database.

name.text: q049 What is a database management system (DBMS)? Explain with suitable examples

questiontext.text: What is a database management system (DBMS)? Explain with suitable examples.

graderinfo.text: A database management system (DBMS) is a program used to create, process, and administer a database. A DBMS is different from a database in that a DBMS is a software program while a database is a collection of tables, relationships, and metadata. Almost no organization develops its own DBMS. Instead, companies license DBMS products from vendors such as IBM, Microsoft, Oracle, and others. Popular DBMS products are DB2 from IBM, Access and SQL Server from Microsoft, and Oracle Database from the Oracle Corporation. Finally, MySQL, also owned by Oracle, is an open source DBMS product that is license-free for most applications.

name.text: q050 Describe the functions of a database management system (DBMS).

questiontext.text: Describe the functions of a database management system (DBMS).

graderinfo.text:
A database management system (DBMS) is a program used to create, process, and administer a database.
1. Database developers use the DBMS to create tables, relationships, and other structures in the database. To create a new table, the developer just fills out a new table's metadata into a form. To modify an existing table–for example, to add a new column–the developer opens the metadata form for that table and adds a new row of metadata.
2. The second function of the DBMS is to process the database. The DBMS provides applications for four processing operations: to read, insert, modify, or delete data. These operations are requested in application calls upon the DBMS. From a form, when the user enters new or changed data, a computer program that processes the form calls the DBMS to make the necessary database changes. From a Web application, a program on the client or on the server application program calls the DBMS directly to make the change.
3. The third DBMS function is to provide tools to assist in the administration of the database. Database administration involves a wide variety of activities. For example, the DBMS can be used to set up a security system involving user accounts, passwords, permissions, and limits for processing the database. In addition to security, DBMS administrative functions include backing up database data, adding structures to improve the performance of database applications, removing data that are no longer wanted or needed and similar tasks.

name.text: q051 Discuss the creation of a database. Explain its working.

questiontext.text: Discuss the creation of a database. Explain its working.

graderinfo.text:
Database developers use the database management system (DBMS) to create tables, relationships, and other structures in the database. A form is used to define a new table or to modify an existing one. To create a new table, the developer just fills the new table's metadata into the form.
To modify an existing table, a developer opens the metadata form for that table and adds a new row of metadata.

name.text: q052 Define Structured Query Language (SQL).

questiontext.text: Define Structured Query Language (SQL).

graderinfo.text: Structured Query Language (SQL) is an international standard language for processing a database. DBMS products like DB2 from IBM, Access and SQL Server from Microsoft, and Oracle Database from the Oracle Corporation accept and process SQL statements. Another popular DBMS that accepts SQL statements is MySQL, an open source DBMS product that is license-free for most applications. One need not understand or remember SQL language syntax. Instead, one needs to just realize that SQL is an international standard for processing a database. Also, SQL can be used to create databases and database structures.

name.text: q071 What is a database application?

questiontext.text: What is a database application?

graderinfo.text:
A database application is a collection of forms, reports, queries, and application programs that serves as an intermediary between users and database data. Database applications reformat database table data to make it more informative and more easily updated. Application programs also have features that provide security, maintain data consistency, and handle special cases. The specific purposes of the four elements of a database application are:
Forms – View data; insert new, update existing, and delete existing data.
Reports – Structured presentation of data using sorting, grouping, filtering, and other operations.
Queries – Search based upon data values provided by the user.
Application programs – Provide security, data consistency, and special-purpose processing, e.g., handle out-of-stock situations.

name.text: q080 What is an in-memory database management system?

questiontext.text: What is an in-memory database management system?

graderinfo.text: An in-memory database management system (DBMS) consists of DBMS products that process databases in main memory. This technique has become possible because today's computer memories can be enormous and can hold an entire database at one time, or at least very large chunks of it. Usually these products support or extend the relational model. SAP HANA is a computer with an in-memory DBMS that provides high-volume ACID transaction support simultaneously with complex relational query processing. Tableau Software's reporting products are supported by a proprietary in-memory DBMS using an extension to SQL.

name.text: q081 Why does a user need to understand database technology?

questiontext.text: Why does a user need to understand database technology?

graderinfo.text: Answers may vary. A user needs to know if database technology can facilitate their project goals. A user should understand how to turn the data stored into useful information. As a user you know what and should be changed in a database. You also understand what should be added or created in a database as technology changes. You may want to create your own simple database.

graderinfo.text: Self-describing means that a database contains within itself, a description of its contents. Similar to a library that contains a catalog that describes the library's contents. The same idea also pertains to a database. A database contain not only data, but also data about the data in the database. Metadata are data that describe data.

name.text: q106 Why don't many new Internet applications need ACID (atomic, consistent, iso

answer.text: Because what is stored today must be stored tomorrow.
Because transactions have to be processed in the same manner.
Internet applications do not necessarily have to store all of a transaction.
Because once a transaction is stored, it never goes away.

name.text: q001 Which of the following statements best defines the cloud?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements best defines the cloud?

answer.text: The cloud is the elastic leasing of pooled computer resources over the Internet.
The cloud is a peer-to-peer network used to share data between users.
The cloud is the elastic leasing of in-house computer hardware.
The cloud is the network of servers hosted in-house by an organization for its own requirements.

name.text: q002 In the context of the cloud, which of the following best describes the term

questiontext.text: In the context of the cloud, which of the following best describes the term elastic?

answer.text: It means that the computing resources leased can be increased or decreased dynamically in cloud-based hosting.
It means that the operations staff manually allots fresh resources when the traffic increases.
It means that the customers are provided a consistent bandwidth on the cloud.
It means that the resources available for cloud-hosting are shared among customers.

name.text: q003 An organization that hires cloud services ________.

questiontext.text: An organization that hires cloud services ________.

answer.text: can accommodate an increase in traffic from only one city
is allowed to change its computer hardware requirements only once in an hour
can limit the response time of its Web pages by adding servers whenever needed
is given access only to a single server

name.text: q004 Which of the following is true about accessing resources over the Internet?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is true about accessing resources over the Internet?

answer.text: The resources are not stored locally on the company premise.
Companies have to maintain servers onsite.
Companies need multiple back generators in case of emergencies.
Companies have to pay for personal to physically care for the servers.

name.text: q005 Which of the following statements is TRUE of cloud-based hosting?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of cloud-based hosting?

answer.text: It makes scaling up to meet the demands of increased traffic difficult.
It involves the risk of investing in technology that may soon become obsolete.
It gives greater control over physical location of data.
It gives little visibility over the security being used to protect data.

name.text: q006 Which of the following is an advantage of in-house hosting?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an advantage of in-house hosting?

answer.text: It gives greater control over the location of data.
It has the ability to adapt to growing or fluctuating demands.
It eliminates the risk of obsolescence.

name.text: q007 Which of the following factors has contributed to an increase in the popula

questiontext.text: Which of the following factors has contributed to an increase in the popularity of cloud hosting?

answer.text: demand for services that can run without the support of the Internet
development of virtualization technology that allows near-instantaneous creation of new virtual machines
development of Web services that can be accessed without meeting the service-oriented architecture specifications
increase in the cost of processors, data communication, and data storage

name.text: q008 Cloud resources are pooled because many different organizations use the sam

questiontext.text: Cloud resources are pooled because many different organizations use the same physical hardware.

name.text: q009 Cloud vendors do not benefit from economies of scale.

questiontext.text: Cloud vendors do not benefit from economies of scale.

name.text: q010 Virtualization increases the scalability of an organization's systems becau

questiontext.text: Virtualization increases the scalability of an organization's systems because it can quickly respond to incremental growth in demand.

name.text: q011 As standard practice, customers are regularly updated by cloud vendors abou

questiontext.text: As standard practice, customers are regularly updated by cloud vendors about the location and number of copies made of their data.

name.text: q012 To use cloud-based hosting, an organization will have to construct its own

questiontext.text: To use cloud-based hosting, an organization will have to construct its own data center.

name.text: q013 Before the creation of personal computers, time-sharing vendors provided sl

questiontext.text: Before the creation of personal computers, time-sharing vendors provided slices of computer time on a use-fee basis.

name.text: q014 Cloud-based hosting is preferred by organizations that are required by law

questiontext.text: Cloud-based hosting is preferred by organizations that are required by law to have physical control over their data.

name.text: q015 Organizations that are required by law to have physical control over their

questiontext.text: Organizations that are required by law to have physical control over their data can benefit from cloud computing using private clouds and virtual private clouds.

name.text: q016 Why is the term elastic used to describe the cloud?

questiontext.text: Why is the term elastic used to describe the cloud?

graderinfo.text: The term elastic means that the computing resources leased can be increased or decreased dynamically, programmatically, in a short span of time, and that organizations pay for just the resources that they use. If the traffic for a Web site hosted on the cloud increases, servers can be increased dynamically to restrict the response time of the Web site.

name.text: q017 Why is the term pooled used to describe the cloud?

questiontext.text: Why is the term pooled used to describe the cloud?

graderinfo.text: Cloud resources are pooled because many different organizations use the same physical hardware, which they share through virtualization. Cloud vendors dynamically allocate virtual machines to physical hardware as customer needs increase or decrease.

name.text: q018 Why is cloud hosting preferred to in-house hosting?

questiontext.text: Why is cloud hosting preferred to in-house hosting?

graderinfo.text: Cloud hosting allows the number of servers being rented to be increased easily. This means any number of customers can access the Web site hosted on the cloud and have the same response time. Large, reputable organizations provide best-of-breed security and disaster recovery. Clients do not have to take the risk of investing in technology that may soon become obsolete; the cloud vendor takes that risk. For these reasons, cloud hosting is preferred to in-house hosting.

name.text: q019 What are the disadvantages of cloud-based hosting?

questiontext.text: What are the disadvantages of cloud-based hosting?

graderinfo.text: The negatives of cloud computing involve loss of control. Users are dependent on a vendor; changes in the vendor's management, policy, and prices are beyond their control. Further, users don't know where their data, which may be a large part of their organization's value, is located. The users don't know how many copies of their data there are or even if they are located in the same country as they are. Finally, users have no visibility into the security and disaster preparedness that is actually in place. Their competitors could be stealing their data and they would not know it.

name.text: q020 What are the factors that have made cloud-based hosting advantageous?

questiontext.text: What are the factors that have made cloud-based hosting advantageous?

graderinfo.text: Three factors have made cloud-based hosting advantageous today. First, processors, data communication, and data storage are so cheap that they are nearly free. At the scale of a Web farm of hundreds of thousands of processors, providing a virtual machine for an hour costs essentially nothing. Data communication is so cheap that getting the data to and from that processor is also nearly free. Second, virtualization technology enables the near instantaneous creation of a new virtual machine. The customer provides (or creates in the cloud) a disk image of the data and programs of the machine it wants to provision. Virtualization software does the rest. Finally, Internet-based standards enable cloud-hosting vendors to provide processing capabilities in flexible, yet standardized, ways.

name.text: q021 Explain why cloud-based hosting does not make sense for some organizations.

questiontext.text: Explain why cloud-based hosting does not make sense for some organizations.

graderinfo.text: The only organizations for which cloud hosting may not make sense are those that are required by law or by industry standard practice to have physical control over their data. Such organizations might be forced to create and maintain their own hosting infrastructure. A financial institution, for example, might be legally required to maintain physical control over its data. Even in this circumstance, however, it is possible to gain many of the benefits of cloud computing using private clouds and virtual private clouds.

name.text: q022 Phobas Inc. offers an online service that stores notes made by customers on

questiontext.text: Phobas Inc. offers an online service that stores notes made by customers on the cloud. When a customer enters notes on a device, it gets updated in all the devices he/she owns. Which of the following cloud-based offerings does Phobas Inc. provide to its customers?

name.text: q023 An online service provider provides its users with hosted computers, an ope

questiontext.text: An online service provider provides its users with hosted computers, an operating system, and a database management system (DBMS). This allows customers to add their own applications to the hosted services. Which of the following cloud-based offerings is being provided to the users?

name.text: q024 The cloud-based service that provides the hardware and allows customers to

questiontext.text: The cloud-based service that provides the hardware and allows customers to load an operating system of their choice is known as ________.

name.text: q025 A ________ is an information system that stores user data in many different

questiontext.text: A ________ is an information system that stores user data in many different geographical locations and makes that data available on demand.

name.text: q026 Which of the following is an advantage of a content delivery network?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an advantage of a content delivery network?

answer.text: It increases the load time of Web pages for the users.
It provides protection from denial-of-service (DOS) attacks.
It increases the reliability by storing the data on a single, large server.
It increases the load on the original server.

name.text: q027 Which of the following statements is TRUE of content delivery networks (CDN

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of content delivery networks (CDNs)?

answer.text: They reduce access costs by delivering data faster.
They distribute data on different servers without any data replication.
They use geographic proximity as the factor to decide which server should deliver a requested content.
They use predetermined servers to deliver content to each location irrespective of traffic changes.

name.text: q028 An internal information system built using Web services is said to be using

questiontext.text: An internal information system built using Web services is said to be using the cloud if it ________.

answer.text: allocates specific servers to each task
offers elasticity in the usage of servers

name.text: q029 Which of the following is a reason for an internal information system that

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a reason for an internal information system that uses Web services to not be considered a cloud?

answer.text: The number of servers is fixed and is not made elastic.
Data transfer is enabled without dependency on the Internet.
Web service standards are not followed, as they are confined within the limits of a company.

name.text: q030 Organizations can dynamically reuse servers that use Web services internall

questiontext.text: Organizations can dynamically reuse servers that use Web services internally by ________.

answer.text: allocating different servers for different services

name.text: q031 To use software as a service (SaaS), a user has to just sign up for the ser

questiontext.text: To use software as a service (SaaS), a user has to just sign up for the service and learn how to use it.

name.text: q032 A content delivery network (CDN) provides a specialized type of platform as

questiontext.text: A content delivery network (CDN) provides a specialized type of platform as a service (PaaS).

name.text: q033 A content delivery network (CDN) services a user's request using the geogra

questiontext.text: A content delivery network (CDN) services a user's request using the geographically closest server.

name.text: q034 Content delivery networks (CDNs) increase a Web page's load time.

questiontext.text: Content delivery networks (CDNs) increase a Web page's load time.

name.text: q035 A routing server determines which content delivery network (CDN) server sho

questiontext.text: A routing server determines which content delivery network (CDN) server should respond to a request in real time.

name.text: q036 Content delivery networks (CDNs) are used to store and deliver content that

questiontext.text: Content delivery networks (CDNs) are used to store and deliver content that rarely changes.

name.text: q037 A user can receive various pieces of a Web page from different servers on a

questiontext.text: A user can receive various pieces of a Web page from different servers on a content delivery network (CDN).

name.text: q038 An elastic load balancer is a feature available in a private cloud that is

questiontext.text: An elastic load balancer is a feature available in a private cloud that is not available in internal information systems, built using Web services.

name.text: q039 An organization's internal information system that does not provide elastic

questiontext.text: An organization's internal information system that does not provide elasticity is still considered a cloud.

name.text: q040 Explain how software as a service (SaaS) works.

questiontext.text: Explain how software as a service (SaaS) works.

graderinfo.text: Software as a service (SaaS) is a category of cloud-based service offering. An organization that provides SaaS provides not only hardware infrastructure, but also an operating system and application programs as well. Apple's iCloud is an example of SaaS. Apple uses it to sync all of its customers' iOS devices. When a customer enters an appointment in her iPhone, Apple automatically pushes that appointment into the calendars on all of that customer's iOS devices. Further, customers can share calendars with others that will be synchronized as well.

name.text: q041 Explain with an example how platform as a service (PaaS) works.

questiontext.text: Explain with an example how platform as a service (PaaS) works.

graderinfo.text: Platform as a service (PaaS) is a category of cloud hosting in which vendors provide hosted computers, an operating system, and possibly a database management system (DBMS). Microsoft Windows Azure, for example, provides servers installed with Windows Server. Customers of Windows Azure then add their own applications on top of the hosted platform.

name.text: q042 Explain how a content delivery network ensures fast delivery of data on dem

questiontext.text: Explain how a content delivery network ensures fast delivery of data on demand.

graderinfo.text: A content delivery network (CDN) is a system of hardware and software that stores user data in many different geographical locations and makes that data available on demand. An organization can use CDN to store copies of its Web pages or other information. The CDN vendor replicates this information on servers, possibly worldwide, so as to minimize latency. When a user demands this information, a routing server determines which CDN server is likely to service a request the fastest. As the traffic changes rapidly, especially for popular sites, such calculations are made in real-time. A request for content at one moment in time could be served by a computer in, say, San Diego, and a few moments later, that same request from that same user might be served by a computer in Salt Lake City.

name.text: q043 What are the advantages of building an internal information system using We

questiontext.text: What are the advantages of building an internal information system using Web services?

graderinfo.text: Organizations can use Web services to build internal information systems that can be accessed by multiple applications. By doing so, internal applications can use these Web services like building blocks. They can use the services that they need–and no more. As the Web services are encapsulated, the system can be altered without affecting other applications. In this way, systems development is more flexible, and it will be faster and hence less costly.

name.text: q044 Sireus Corp. has availed a cloud-based service. As this service provides ha

questiontext.text: Sireus Corp. has availed a cloud-based service. As this service provides hardware and operating systems, Sireus Corp. can easily install its software on this cloud product. Which of the following services has the company availed from its cloud vendor?

name.text: q045 If an organization opts for software as a service (SaaS), it will have to _

questiontext.text: If an organization opts for software as a service (SaaS), it will have to ________.

answer.text: install an operating system on the server

name.text: q046 A vendor providing software as a service (SaaS) usually makes the software

questiontext.text: A vendor providing software as a service (SaaS) usually makes the software available as a thin-client.

name.text: q047 If software licensed from others is to be installed on the cloud, licenses

questiontext.text: If software licensed from others is to be installed on the cloud, licenses that permit replication must be purchased.

name.text: q048 Database management system (DBMS) products are included in infrastructure a

questiontext.text: Database management system (DBMS) products are included in infrastructure as a service (IaaS).

name.text: q049 A small company is likely to choose infrastructure as a service (IaaS) as i

questiontext.text: A small company is likely to choose infrastructure as a service (IaaS) as it does not require much technical expertise to load operating systems on a server.

name.text: q050 What is a virtual private network?

questiontext.text: What is a virtual private network?

answer.text: It is a markup language that fixes several HyperText Markup Language (HTML) deficiencies and is commonly used for program-to-program interaction over the Web.
It is an add-on to browsers that was developed by Adobe and is useful for providing animation, movies, and other advanced graphics inside a browser.
It is the most common language for defining the structure and layout of Web pages.
It is a connection that uses the Internet to create secure point-to-point connections.

name.text: q051 Which of the following is TRUE of a virtual private network (VPN)?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE of a virtual private network (VPN)?

answer.text: It provides a secure connection for information transmitted over the public Internet.
It is limited to organizational use.
It can be used to store highly sensitive information of an organization.

name.text: q052 Which of the following is an advantage of a virtual private network (VPN)?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an advantage of a virtual private network (VPN)?

answer.text: It can be used to physically connect a client and the server.
It helps to securely access information over the public Internet.
It facilitates easy access to an organization's data without requiring security access.
It does not depend on the Internet to function effectively.

name.text: q053 Which of the following statements is TRUE of private clouds?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of private clouds?

answer.text: Private clouds are easy to build and operate.
Several organizations pool their resources to form a private cloud.
Private clouds provide access from outside an organization that it created without requiring a person to connect to a virtual private network.
Idle servers in a private cloud cannot be repurposed for use by other organizations.

name.text: q054 Which of the following is an advantage of a private cloud in an organizatio

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an advantage of a private cloud in an organization?

answer.text: It reduces the complexity involved in using other publicly available cloud services.
It eliminates the need to use an additional secure network to access this cloud from outside the organization.
It allows the organization to repurpose its idle servers for use to other organizations.
It allows the organization to manage its servers with elastic load balancing.

name.text: q055 Which of the following statements is TRUE of a virtual private cloud (VPC)?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of a virtual private cloud (VPC)?

answer.text: A VPC does not make use of a virtual private network.
A VPC generally stores an organization's most sensitive data.
A VPC can be accessed only from within an organization.
A VPC can be built on a public cloud infrastructure.

name.text: q056 Which of the following is a difference between a virtual private network (V

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a difference between a virtual private network (VPN) and a virtual private cloud (VPC)?

answer.text: A VPC uses encrypted connections between the users and its server, while a VPN does not use such secure connections.
A VPC can be accessed over the Internet, while a VPN cannot be accessed over the Internet.
A VPC does not facilitate data storage, while a VPN allows the storage of a user's most important data.
A VPC provides the advantages of cloud storage, but a VPN by itself cannot provide these advantages.

name.text: q057 Which of the following is an advantage of using a private cloud over a virt

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an advantage of using a private cloud over a virtual private cloud (VPC)?

answer.text: Unlike a VPC, the infrastructure required for a private cloud can be built and operated easily.
Unlike a VPC, a private cloud can be created and used without the Internet.
Unlike a VPC, a private cloud can be built on top of a public cloud infrastructure.
Unlike a VPC, a private cloud does not require permission from regulating bodies to host sensitive data.

name.text: q058 A tunnel is a virtual, private pathway over a public or shared network from

questiontext.text: A tunnel is a virtual, private pathway over a public or shared network from the virtual private network (VPN) client to the VPN server.

name.text: q059 A virtual private network uses the Internet to create the appearance of pri

questiontext.text: A virtual private network uses the Internet to create the appearance of private, secure connections.

name.text: q060 A virtual private network (VPN) uses encryption and decryption to protect V

questiontext.text: A virtual private network (VPN) uses encryption and decryption to protect VPN communications from snooping.

name.text: q061 A virtual private cloud allows organizations to gain the advantages of clou

questiontext.text: A virtual private cloud allows organizations to gain the advantages of cloud storage for the portion of data that need not be physically controlled.

name.text: q062 Explain how a user in a hotel in Los Angeles can connect to a local area ne

questiontext.text: Explain how a user in a hotel in Los Angeles can connect to a local area network (LAN) at a Michigan site using a virtual private network.

graderinfo.text: A virtual private network (VPN) uses the Internet to create the appearance of private, secure connections. The remote user is the VPN client. That client first establishes a public connection to the Internet. The connection can be obtained by accessing a local ISP or by using a direct Internet connection. Once the Internet connection is made, VPN software on the remote user's computer establishes a connection with the VPN server in Michigan. The VPN client and VPN server then have a secure connection.

name.text: q063 How are communications secured from snooping in a virtual private network?

questiontext.text: How are communications secured from snooping in a virtual private network?

graderinfo.text: In order to secure virtual private network (VPN) communications over the public Internet, the VPN client software encrypts, or codes, messages so their contents are protected from snooping. Then, the VPN client appends the Internet address of the VPN server to the message and sends that package over the Internet to the VPN server. When the VPN server receives the message, it strips its address off the front of the message, decrypts the coded message, and sends the plain text message to the original address inside the LAN. In this way, secure private messages are delivered over the public Internet.

name.text: q064 What is a private cloud? What are its limitations?

questiontext.text: What is a private cloud? What are its limitations?

graderinfo.text: A private cloud is a cloud that is owned and operated by an organization for its own benefit. Private clouds provide the advantages of elasticity, but to a questionable benefit. Organizations cannot repurpose their idle servers for use by other companies. Even a large conglomerate or major international company that uses the idle servers to balance processing loads across subsidiary business units and across different geographical regions is unlikely to save money or time. It is unimaginable that any noncloud company could build and operate a cloud service facility that competes with those provided by the existing large cloud vendors. Also, most organizations choose not to replicate database servers because of the complexity of managing multiple database servers.

name.text: q065 What is a virtual private cloud? What are its advantages?

questiontext.text: What is a virtual private cloud? What are its advantages?

graderinfo.text: A virtual private cloud (VPC) is a subset of a public cloud that has highly restricted, secure access. An organization can build its own VPC on top of public cloud infrastructure. Using a VPC, an organization can store its most sensitive data on its own infrastructure, and store the less sensitive data on the VPC. In this way, organizations that are required to have physical control over some of their data can place that data on their own servers and locate the rest of their data on the VPC. This is a feature that is not available in a private cloud.

name.text: q066 Which of the following is likely to be a consequence of cloud computing in

questiontext.text: Which of the following is likely to be a consequence of cloud computing in the future?

answer.text: The preference to set up one's own computing infrastructure will increase among organizations.
The cost of obtaining elastic resources will decrease.
The demand for employees who know how to use and manage information systems will reduce.
The number of technology-based startups will stagnate.

name.text: q067 A(n) ________ is an information system (IS) that provides computer-based ac

questiontext.text: A(n) ________ is an information system (IS) that provides computer-based activity at a distance.

name.text: q068 A remote system designed by Alpha Solutions uses cameras and motion-sensing

questiontext.text: A remote system designed by Alpha Solutions uses cameras and motion-sensing equipment to issue tickets for traffic violations. This system is an example of ________.

name.text: q069 Large Web farms are likely to replace in-house servers used by small compan

questiontext.text: Large Web farms are likely to replace in-house servers used by small companies due to the benefits of cloud computing.

name.text: q070 Cloud computing can enable organizations to readily obtain elastic resource

questiontext.text: Cloud computing can enable organizations to readily obtain elastic resources at very low costs.

name.text: q071 Cloud computing is likely to lead to an increase in the number of technolog

questiontext.text: Cloud computing is likely to lead to an increase in the number of technology-based startups.

name.text: q072 Telediagnosis uses telecommunications to link surgeons to robotic equipment

questiontext.text: Telediagnosis uses telecommunications to link surgeons to robotic equipment at distant locations.

name.text: q073 Teleaction increases the value of local mediocrity.

questiontext.text: Teleaction increases the value of local mediocrity.

name.text: q074 Remote action systems increase time and travel expenses.

questiontext.text: Remote action systems increase time and travel expenses.

name.text: q075 Until about the late 1980s, organizations primarily used ________ for their

questiontext.text: Until about the late 1980s, organizations primarily used ________ for their internal data processing needs?

name.text: q076 Cloud computing architecture allows employees to use devices connected with

questiontext.text: Cloud computing architecture allows employees to use devices connected with IoT.

name.text: q077 Benefits of using the cloud include all of the following EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: Benefits of using the cloud include all of the following EXCEPT ________.

name.text: q078 A company decides to run advertising during the NCAA Final Four tournament.

questiontext.text: A company decides to run advertising during the NCAA Final Four tournament. They are not sure how traffic their website will get so they decide to lease what they think they need and can easily add more if necessary. This is called ________.

name.text: q079 Cloud vendors benefit from ________ because the average cost of production

questiontext.text: Cloud vendors benefit from ________ because the average cost of production decreases as the size of the operation increases.

name.text: q080 Software as a system is a fundamental cloud type.

questiontext.text: Software as a system is a fundamental cloud type.

name.text: q081 All of the following are examples of SaaS EXCEPT ________.

questiontext.text: All of the following are examples of SaaS EXCEPT ________.

name.text: q082 Amazon Redshift offers ________.

questiontext.text: Amazon Redshift offers ________.

name.text: q083 Cloud security is 100% security proof.

questiontext.text: Cloud security is 100% security proof.

name.text: q084 Using a VPC, an organization can store its ________.

questiontext.text: Using a VPC, an organization can store its ________.

name.text: q085 In the future, there may be additional cloud services that go beyond IaaS,

questiontext.text: In the future, there may be additional cloud services that go beyond IaaS, SaaS, and PaaS.

name.text: q086 Thin clients are sometimes called ________.

questiontext.text: Thin clients are sometimes called ________.

name.text: q087 The cloud was named as such because it was a cloudy outside on the day it w

questiontext.text: The cloud was named as such because it was a cloudy outside on the day it was invented.

name.text: q088 Prior to the cloud, interorganizational processing was a long, slow, and ex

questiontext.text: Prior to the cloud, interorganizational processing was a long, slow, and expensive process.

name.text: q089 Strictly speaking, using Web services internally is not using the cloud bec

questiontext.text: Strictly speaking, using Web services internally is not using the cloud because ________.

answer.text: internal web services do not provide elasticity
internal web services use pooled resources
internal web services use infrastructure as a service
internal web services only using Microsoft Windows Azure

name.text: q090 When leasing EC2, Amazon preinstalls either ________ or Windows Server on t

questiontext.text: When leasing EC2, Amazon preinstalls either ________ or Windows Server on the cloud hardware.

name.text: q091 What are the advantages and limitations of private clouds within smaller or

questiontext.text: What are the advantages and limitations of private clouds within smaller organizations?

graderinfo.text: What can organizations do with their idle servers? They could realize some cost savings by shutting down idle servers. But unlike cloud vendors, they cannot repurpose them for use by other companies. Possibly a large conglomerate or major international company could balance processing loads across subsidiary business units and across different geographical regions. 3M, for example, might balance processing for its different product groups and on different continents, but it is difficult to imagine that, in doing so, it would save money or time. A company like eHermes is very unlikely to develop a private cloud.

name.text: q092 Google Fiber plans on offering Internet connections that are 100 times fast

questiontext.text: Google Fiber plans on offering Internet connections that are 100 times faster than the average broadband connection.

name.text: q093 Which of the following is a negative aspect of the cloud?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a negative aspect of the cloud?

answer.text: The overall size of the cloud is getting bigger.
There will be faster Internet connections.
Large web farms will require fewer employees.
Organizations will readily obtain elastic resource at a low cost.

name.text: q094 In the future, service providers may provide ________ to help companies eva

questiontext.text: In the future, service providers may provide ________ to help companies evaluate the mountains of big data the companies they are collecting.

name.text: q095 United Healthcare treats video-based doctor visits the same as regular doct

questiontext.text: United Healthcare treats video-based doctor visits the same as regular doctor visits.
